name: neovim

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: generator
variants.description: the build system generator to use

variants.name: no_luajit
variants.description: use lua rather than luajit as lua language provider

description: Neovim: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: ninja
dependencies.description:
Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from
other build systems in two major respects: it is designed to have its
input files generated by a higher-level build system, and it is designed
to run builds as fast as possible.

dependencies.name: lua-lang
dependencies.description: Flast flexible JITed lua

dependencies.name: luajit
dependencies.description: Flast flexible JITed lua

dependencies.name: lua
dependencies.description: The Lua programming language interpreter and library.

dependencies.name: lua-ffi
dependencies.description: luajit FFI for interpreted lua

dependencies.name: lua-bitlib
dependencies.description: Lua-jit-like bitwise operations for lua

dependencies.name: pkgconfig
dependencies.description:
pkgconf is a program which helps to configure compiler and linker flags
for development frameworks. It is similar to pkg-config from
freedesktop.org, providing additional functionality while also
maintaining compatibility.

dependencies.name: gettext
dependencies.description: GNU internationalization (i18n) and localization (l10n) library.

dependencies.name: gperf
dependencies.description:
GNU gperf is a perfect hash function generator. For a given list of
strings, it produces a hash function and hash table, in form of C or C++
code, for looking up a value depending on the input string. The hash
function is perfect, which means that the hash table has no collisions,
and the hash table lookup needs a single string comparison only.

dependencies.name: jemalloc
dependencies.description:
jemalloc is a general purpose malloc(3) implementation that emphasizes
fragmentation avoidance and scalable concurrency support.

dependencies.name: lua-lpeg
dependencies.description: pattern-matching for lua

dependencies.name: lua-mpack
dependencies.description: lua bindings to libmpack

dependencies.name: iconv
dependencies.description: Dummy package to provide interfaces available in libc.

dependencies.name: libtermkey
dependencies.description: Easy keyboard entry processing for terminal programs

dependencies.name: libuv
dependencies.description: Multi-platform library with a focus on asynchronous IO

dependencies.name: libluv
dependencies.description:
This library makes libuv available to lua scripts. It was made for the
luvit project but should usable from nearly any lua project.

dependencies.name: libvterm
dependencies.description: An abstract library implementation of a terminal emulator

dependencies.name: msgpack-c
dependencies.description: A small, fast binary interchange format convertible to/from JSON

dependencies.name: unibilium
dependencies.description: A terminfo parsing library

dependencies.name: tree-sitter
dependencies.description:
Tree-sitter is a parser generator tool and an incremental parsing
library. It can build a concrete syntax tree for a source file and
efficiently update the syntax tree as the source file is edited.
